hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1379 a and today's date is
September 15th 2017 and the top of the
episode is GDP has revised much lower as
economic indicators worsen let's get
into the economic collapse financial
news now as we can see the economy well
a lot of the economic indicators they
are deteriorating and it looks like
we're getting a lot of revisions coming
in and of course they're blaming the
Hurricanes for most of this and we can
see that this has been going on for
quite a while
the Hurricanes aren't going to make the
economy all of a sudden go down the
tubes because it hit Texas or it hit
Florida the rest of the country was not
hit so this is kind of ridiculous at
this point but they're gonna try to
build this up and make it seem like this
is the main problem of why the economy
is not doing well now the you Mitch
which is the University of Michigan's
headline consumer confidence index it
slipped lower in September from ninety
six point eight to ninety five point
three and what has happened is basically
Hope has tumbled right now people are
looking at the economy looking at what's
been going on and they're starting to
realize there are problems now does this
mean that everyone in the country
believes this no there's a lot there I
would say a big portion of the country
that thinks yes the economy is going to
be doing well it's going to be doing
better and things are going to improve
but what we're really seeing is that
things are starting to break down now we
mentioned yesterday about retail how
retail is not doing that well and it's
starting to break down even further and
we see on the corporate media they have
to report that there's something wrong
with media and they're out there saying
that retail sales
well then unexpectedly I like what I
like when they use that term
unexpectedly fell in August what we know
why they fell in love is it's not
because of the hurricanes it's because
people are just not spending people are
losing their jobs and basically they
reported that sales have dropped by 0.2
percent more dacovia motor vehicle sales
have tumbled by 1.6 percent and we see
at this point that we are in big trouble
right now we're heading into the holiday
season and
every holiday season that we looked at
it's just gotten worse and worse and
worse and when you think about this the
unemployment numbers have come down but
sales have also declined at the same or
faster pace
so there are problems now why is this a
problem why is this happening well there
are a couple reports out there and we
can see that Americans right now they
are scraping by with almost no money in
their savings account now the st. Louis
Federal Reserve said the personal
savings rate in June of 2017 was a
measly three point eight percent or
three dollars and 80 cents for every one
hundred these people earn with the
medium household income in the u.s. at
just north of around fifty thousand
dollars that would amount to about four
thousand dollars a year now another
study from go banking rates found that
69 percent of Americans surveyed had
less than 1,000 in savings and about
one-third had no money in reserve now
remember the US economy is based on 70
percent of consumption the GDP is based
on the people going out and spending on
retail so people are not spending
because spending is down people aren't
saving there is a major problem now
people have been ramping up and putting
a lot of money on their credit cards
because this is the only way they can
survive now the Federal Reserve their
data shows that the aggregate credit
card debt had hit an all-time high of
about one point zero to seven trillion
dollars so when we put all this together
it shows that people cannot save people
cannot spend and people have to put
whatever they possibly can to survive on
their credit card why is this well
there's a lot of people that don't have
jobs or people making a lot less money
than they used to and again we can see
this from everywhere we look I mean look
at retail look at the housing market
look at what is going on around the
country because people
they just can't find those high-paying
jobs even though they're telling us the
unemployment numbers are very very low
that we're almost at full employment
capacity it makes no sense now when we
look at the housing market we can see
and this is coming from Adam data
solutions they released some information
about home flipping and we saw this back
in 2008 where there were a lot of people
flipping homes they go to those areas
where there these houses are
appreciating very very quickly they
purchased the house and they go ahead
and they flip them so these people once
again are out there and they're doing
the same exact thing now what's very
interesting about this is that one in
four home sales are flips in a certain
number of cities or areas and those
correlate to those areas where
case-shiller shows that houses are
moving up in prices I mean if we look we
could see that Miami is one of them
Washington is one of them New York is
one of them Los Angeles is one of them
Philadelphia is one of them and they are
basically going in because houses are
appreciating they got bubbles in these
areas and they are flipping the homes
now more than 35% of the homes flipped
in the second quarter of 20 2017 were
purchased by the flipper with financing
up from thirty three point two percent
in the previous quarter and up from
thirty two point three percent a year
ago to the highest level since the third
quarter of 2008 this is nearly a
nine-year high we are back to where we
were in 2008 we're running into the same
exact problems they created these
bubbles they created the illusion that
the economy is doing well these people
are out flipping and guess what happens
when the economy turns down all these
people are in trouble because traffic
will dry up if they have two or three
four flips that they're doing right now
guess what they can't move them they are
stuck with them well we see right now
from Morgan Stanley well there's a
problem in Manhattan residential real
estate it looks like it's headed for a
crash now we reported on this once
before
and what we're seeing right now is that
it is not doing well whatsoever
New York City's commercial real estate
market well that is not doing well and
we could see that all these properties
that have been purchased by Chinese
corporations and other foreign foreign
entities well this is starting to dry up
especially from China because now
they're diverting all their funds and
they're using therefore the Belton Road
and what we're seeing right now is
there's an 84 percent drop in over
seized property investment by Chinese
corporations during this year and
another 18% will most likely happen in
2018 now this is a huge decline and this
is hitting the commercial real estate
this is hitting the residential real

now is that the entire Manhattan area
San Francisco and many other cities
they're starting to see a downturn in
rents a downturn in people purchasing
these homes we're seeing prices they are
coming down we're seeing the vacancy
rate it has climbed from 2 point 2 / 7
percent from 2 point 1 4 percent a year
earlier and this is the first annual
increase since February and we're headed
into a a whole mess of trouble here
another troubling sign in Manhattan is
real estate developers rents in August
declined in almost every minute Hatton
neighborhood condo sales dropped by 11
percent compared to last year at this
time and we can see the whole thing is
just imploding on itself and this is how
it begins now remember the New York Fed
the Atlanta Fed they were out there they
were estimating the GDP numbers they
were saying they were going to be around
4% 3.8 percent they said it was going to
be fantastic and now they can use the
excuse of the hurricanes to say well you
know something maybe these were too high
let's bring them back down
and of course we're getting other
information from retail from housing
from everywhere else that the economy is
not doing
well so they readjusted their GDP
numbers they brought it down from almost
4% we are now down to around 2.2 percent
more in line of where we've seen in the
past and actually this is probably gonna
go a little bit lower than this and who
knows I might revise the whole thing we
know this is completely manipulated so
at this point what they're really
showing us makes no difference if we go
to shadow stats we can see the real GDP
numbers well they're around the negative
area right now and I'm sure that this is
gonna go below 2% just like it's been
for the last many many years we've never
really hit 3% or 4% that's completely
gone
remember they manipulated the GDP
numbers they went all the way back to
they included research and development
they massage the numbers they added
Obama care I mean they did whatever they
possibly can to bring these numbers up
but we could see right now that it's
completely falling apart and these four
percent GDP numbers we knew that this
was completely fake phony and false but
they do have an excuse they're gonna use
the Hurricanes as the excuse but what's
really happening is the economy is still
on that down downward trend that
downward slide and it's not improving
whatsoever we see that no one really
cares about the debt nobody really cares
about how much debt there is in the
system and we as a nation we are going
broke I mean total US public debt
remember it just hit twenty point one
trillion dollars now after Congress
suspended the debt limit last Friday the
Treasury went ahead and reported 300
billion of off-balance
spending they run up over the last six
months since hitting the debt ceiling in
March so at thirty four thousand eight
hundred eighty dollars of new debt per
second the federal government is running
up the debt at speeds that are over that
like the speed of light here and they
have gotten completely out of control
and guess what they're gonna have to do
they're gonna have to spend more and
more and more we see that industrial
production it took a dive at that point
nine percent and we see right now that
they expected that this was going to be
again but it wasn't it was a drop in
industrial production and here's the
kicker this number that is coming
it's not based on the hurricane it was
already negative without the impact of
the Hurricanes so this is another area
which shows that the economy industrial
production GDP retail sales housing this
has nothing to do with the bad weather
this has to do with the constant
deterioration of the economy the economy
is not improving it's getting worse the
debt is continually rising actually the
Adept are pace than it ever has before
and we see right now there's nothing the
government nothing Trump nothing anyone
can do about this because the system
cannot be sustained think about your
household if you were making say fifty
thousand dollars a year let's just use
that as a base and you weren't getting
any raises or anything like that but
everything was going up your auto
insurance your health insurance your
rent was going up or if you own a house
your taxes were going up and all the
other expenses food and everything else
was going up and you're only making a
certain amount of funds coming into the
home guess what would happen you would
have to borrow some money to make up the
difference and as the cost of everything
continually rises you'd have to borrow
some more then you have interest
payments on that you'd have to borrow
some more to make up for the interest
payments to pay for the things that are
going up and this cycle cannot be ended
it just continues and you'll be taking
on more debt and eventually what happens
everything gets out of whack you can't
do it anymore you don't have enough
money coming in you can't survive you
can't borrow anymore and this is what's
happening to the US government the debt
level is increasing that tax revenues
instead of saying even they are falling
so they're not bringing in the same
amount of tax revenue because people
really don't have jobs and as the debt
Rises and as the cost of all these
programs go up and guess what happens
everything falls apart as people lose
their jobs GDP and everything else falls
apart this is why this can't be
Stane this is why they've been creating
and printing money as fast as they
possibly can this is why the Fed is out
there with stimulus this is why the ECB
is out there with stimulus because they
realized without all of this the whole
thing just comes crashing down it's
going to come crashing down no matter
what they're just prolonging it just
like people who are in the boat of you
know taking on more debt trying to make

have to go bankrupt because they can't
continue on with it it's completely
impossible this is what's happening here
does it happen in a snap of a finger now
think about your own household you maybe

years and then all of a sudden it's like
no we can't do this anymore
we can't afford this we can't make the

and this is why you need to be ready and
